bibl.title: Chin Quock Wah vs. Henry M. White. Criminal.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Western District Court of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION
In the Matter of the Application of CHIN QUOCK WAH, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus. ) No.2971. RETURN.
Comes now Henry M. White, Commissioner of Immigration at Seattle, Washington, and as a return to the Petition in the above entitled matter, alleges:
- I - That he denys each and every allegation except what is specifically hereinafter admitted.

- II - That as to the first paragraph of said Petition, the date, 14th day of September, should be, 13th day of September; and the 25th day of November is the date of the issuance of the order, the evidence having been taken from time to time prior to that date, and the appeal was taken on November 27, 1914, instead of November 25th. Respondent admits the other allegations in paragraph one save and except that the imprisonment, confinement and restraint, and Order of Deportation were illegal, which said allegation he denys.
- III- Answering paragraph two, respondent admits through the word "China" in line seven, and denys each and every other allegation in said paragraph.
- IV - Answering paragraphs three, four, five and six, respondent denys each and every allegation therein contained.
And for a further and separate answer and return to said petition for a Writ of Habeas Corpus, said Henry M. White alleges:

That the petitioner in the above entitled action sough admission as a minor son of a domiciled merchant and was excluded on the ground that his father was a laborer and not a merchant, as appears original record, duly certified by the Secretary of Labor, marked exhibit "A" and made a part of this return.
div1.ab: Henry M White Commissioner of Immigration.
div1.p: THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA NORTHERN DIVISION WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON ) ss.

Henry M. White, being first duly sworn, upon his oath deposes and says: That he is the Commissioner of Immigration named in the foregoing Return; that he has read the said Return, knows the contents thereof and believes the same to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 13th day of March, 1915.
div1.ab: Walter S Martin Notary Public in and for the State of Washington residing in Seattle
div1.p: -ved a copy of the within Return this 13 day of Mar 19 5
IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITD STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON. Northern DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of CHIN QUOCK WAH, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
2x FILED IN THE U. S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION MAR151915
div1.ab: FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By EML Deputy
